channel.title: Some Eye-Catching Things to do in YOUR Topic Thread!
channel.description:
Here are [size=18pt]Some Eye-Catching Things to do in [u]YOUR[/u] Topic Thread![/size] [size=14pt]Some tips and tricks.[/size] [ul][li]Start off with a good title, you can also consider this to be done later.[/li] [list] [li]I like to make the title simple. The server name - Server Logo | Recent update/Motivational new message everyday like me and Evelus do (We kinda stopped hehe).[/li] [li]Do NOT make it like:
WANT A SEXY FUN RSPS???? I AM HERE TO SHOW U ONE!! FRE ITEMS COOL EIGHT???
Is this professional at all? [/list] [li]Do [b]NOT[/b] make your thread so gibbered that it looks bad with pictures on it.[/li] [list] [li]Don't make it like:[/li] [list] [li]
[size=15pt]SERVER NAME[/size] [size=18pt]text[/size] text [size=14pt]TEXT!!![/size] some more text aw ma God!! [size=24pt]link[/size] client download link: hi things about server: revision -Bunch of random stuff in the server OWNERNAME is owner [size=36pt]PLAY NOW <3[/size]
^ That will destroy a viewers mood completely. [/list] [/list] [li]Make an update log! Without an update log, there is no hype in the server! No enthusiasm! You don't want that, do you?[/li] [list] [li]I know what you're thinking. "Lol, update log on advertisement thread." But it's a very useful tool and due the advertisement thread being seen more than a development thread, it'd be ideal to keep your users motivated.[/li] [li]Only make an update log on the thread you are sure you will update the most, not when you are advertising on a forum you are non-native to.[/li] [list] [li]Prety sure this is unclear, so let me make an example.[/li] [list] [li]I am known in let's say Rune-Server. I go to moparscape and sythe (or however it's spelt :P) and advertise there. Now I think, if I put an update log, will I update on all the thread. Your answer is most likely no. So, the the strategy is that you only put the update log in rune-server and link the people to your update log.[/li] [/list] [li]Or, you can make a blog and post every update there. Link your users there![/li] [/list] [/list] [li]One of the most worst strategies is to say you are having open staff spots. [b]DO NOT SAY THAT![/b] If you do, you will attract immature people staff hunting, and believe me, that's never good.[/li] [list] [li]These types of people will leave your server like trash.[/li] [li]Another strategy is that people say free donator and/or free items. Do never do this either, it just will attract hungry people looking for gold.[/li] [/list] [li]Please, do [b]NOT[/b], do [b]NOT[/b], do [b]NOT[/b], use another threads pictures. It is just plain bad.[/li] [li]Proper grammar. Period.[/li] [list] [li]A typo is fine, but a sentence like:[/li] [list] [li]
plz come Staff member will be Good Treat you weLL becuZ we liKez you soo much dud!
[/li] [/list] [li] ^ That is plain unacceptable.[/li] [/list] [li]No pictures, no clickers. Common internet rule, don't make people look at the server themselves.[/li] [list] [li]Professional pictures please.[/li] [/list] [li]Please, put important links at the top of the topic under your logo/server name.[/li] [list] [li]Do it kinda like:[/li] [list] [li]
[URL=http://www.youtube.com/][img width=50 height=50]http://www.indyzoo.com/SiteAssets/YouTube%20icon%20button.png[/img][/URL][URL=http://www.facebook.com/][img]http://www.steadmanuhlich.com/facebook-icon-50x50.jpg[/img][/url][url=http://www.wordpress.com/][img]http://findicons.com/files/icons/1979/social/50/wordpress.png[/img][/url]
[/li] [/list] [/list] [li]Got a promotional video? Okay! Put that below your logo/title, and if you have links, above the links.[/li] [list] [li]Like:[/li] [list] [li]
[size=24pt]SERVER NAME[/size] Promo video here.
[/li] [/list] [/list] [li]In beta and looking to motivate users? Go for a current stage statement.[/li] [list] [li]A current stage statement is:[/li] [list] [li]
[b]Current stage: Beta[/b]
[/list] [li]Put this under your links/promotional video.[/li] [/list][/ul] Well, I only made this thread because I saw flaws in multiple advertisements, and I hope this thread benefits you. -Arham P.S. I do not mean to offend anyone in this thread.
